    Function reference

    All functions

    consistency_mirror()
    Mirror Statistics from a Single Split
    consistency_mirror_multisplit()
    Compute Mirrors across Splits The mirror of consistency_mirror works on effects derived from a single split. In practice, we will want to have mirror statistics across a multiple splits. This is a small wrapper of that function that computes mirrors for effects available along a list.
    counterfactual_ts()
    Generate Counterfactual versions of a ts_inter object
    lag_from_names()
    Detect the time lags based on column names
    mbtransfer()
    Transfer Function Model for ts_inter objects
    mbtransfer_model-class
    Transfer Function Model Class
    mbtransfer_predict()
    Prediction method for mbtransfer objects
    model_predict_single()
    Prediction for a Single Subject
    model_predict_step()
    Predictions for a single timepoint and subject
    patchify_df()
    Sliding Windows for a ts_inter object
    patchify_single()
    Sliding Windows for a ts_inter_single object
    patchify_single_df()
    Convert patchify_single output into a data.frame
    pd_effects()
    Counterfactual Partial Dependence Effects
    pd_splits()
    Mirror Splits from Partial Dependence
    pivot_ts()
    Joined ts dfs
    predict(<mbtransfer_model>)
    Prediction method for mbtransfer models
    predictor_names()
    Create uniform column names for patchified df
    predictors()
    Generate a Predictor Matrix
    pulses()
    Hypothetical Pulse Interventions
    replace_inter_()
    ts is a single element of a ts_inter class
    select_taxa()
    Significant Taxa using Mirror Statistics
    steps()
    Hypothetical Step Interventions
    subset_values()
    Subset values of a ts object
    time_lags()
    Detect the time lags over which a model was trained
